org.wikipedia.miner.model
Class WikipediaDatabase

java.lang.Object
  org.wikipedia.miner.util.MySqlDatabase
      org.wikipedia.miner.model.WikipediaDatabase

public class WikipediaDatabase
extends MySqlDatabase

This class loads, provides access to and maintains the Wikipedia database. It most cases it should not be used directly - use a Wikipedia instance instead. NOTE: Each wikipedia database is only intended to store one instance of Wikipedia. If you require more, (for different languages, or from different points in time) then you must create seperate databases.

Author:
David Milne

Constructor Detail

WikipediaDatabase

public WikipediaDatabase(java.lang.String server,
                         java.lang.String databaseName,
                         java.lang.String userName,
                         java.lang.String password)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
Initializes a newly created WikipediaDatabase and attempts to make a connection to the mysql database defined by the arguments given, as defined by MySqlDatabase. In addition, it will check that the wikipedia database is complete; that all necessary tables and indexes exist.

Parameters:
server - the connection string for the server (e.g 130.232.231.053:8080 or bob:8080)
databaseName - the name of the database (e.g enwiki)
userName - the user for the sql database (null if anonymous)
password - the users password (null if anonymous)
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if a connection cannot be made.

loadData

public void loadData(java.io.File directory,
                     boolean overwrite)
              throws java.sql.SQLException,
                     java.io.IOException
Loads a directory of summarized csv tables into the database. If overwrite is set to true, then all previously stored data is overwritten. If any core files ('page', 'pagelink', 'categorylink', 'redirect', 'disambiguation', 'translation', 'pagelink', 'stats') are missing or unreadable, then this method will fail without making any modifications to the stored data, regardless of overwrite. If any optional files are found (e.g. 'content', or 'ngram') then these will be loaded as well.

Parameters:
directory - the directory in which the data files are located
overwrite - true if existing tables are to be overwritten
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if there is a problem with the database
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem with the files to be loaded.

checkDatabase

public void checkDatabase()
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
Checks that this database contains all core tables.

Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if it doesnt.

checkMorphologicalProcessor

public void checkMorphologicalProcessor(MorphologicalProcessor morphologicalProcessor)
                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
Checks if the database has been prepared for use with a particular morphological processor

Parameters:
morphologicalProcessor - the morphologicalProcessor to be checked.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if the data has not been prepared for this morphologicalProcessor.
